intro: Sorocea jaramilloi, commonly known as the Jaramillo's sorocea, is a rare flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and grows in shaded, humid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is often found in protected areas.
